title: SoftBank’s boss is ‘embarrassed and flustered’ by track record amid WeWork trouble
text:
The billionaire boss of Japanese tech titan SoftBank has admitted he is “embarrassed and flustered” after a string of bets by the company’s $100bn Vision Fund went sour.

Masayoshi Son said he is concerned by performance at Softbank, which has come into the firing line over unfortunate punts on the likes of WeWork and Uber that risk causing billions of dollars of losses.

Mr Son said: “The results still have a long way to go and that makes me embarrassed and flustered.

“I used to envy the scale of the markets in the US and China, but now you see red-hot growth companies coming out of small markets like in south-east Asia.

“There is just no excuse for entrepreneurs in Japan, myself included.”

Office rental start-up Wework – which has been handed $10bn by SoftBank – has suffered a stunning change in fortune since it announced it would go public in August.

Concerns over the firm’s management and business model have seen its valuation slashed from $47bn to just $10bn in total, while chief executive Adam Neumann has been forced to quit.
description: The billionaire boss of Japanese tech titan SoftBank has admitted he is “embarrassed and flustered” after a string of bets by the company’s $100bn Vision Fund went sour.
